title: Customer Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland
Interview Descriptions: They are very informative. Everyone seemed welcoming. If you do not ge the role you will know because if you don't get a call in a week they are definitely ghosting you.
Interview Questions: What skills do you plan to bring to this role?

title: Food Server Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland
Interview Descriptions: The interview was thirty minutes long. Was not too bad, but you should prepare before. The environment was welcoming and not intimidating, overall positive and producing experience. Review your resume prior.
Interview Questions: What is your prior experience in food service?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: This was a fairly easy interview process where I met with the program administrator, director, and a faculty member. They were very kind and professional, and they asked straight-forward questions.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous experience as it pertains to the Program Assistant position.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Comprehensive, great dynamic team.  Diverse and strong questions.  Open opportunity to use my experience to broaden the focus on the job.  Worth every minute.  Look forward to hearing how things work moving forward.
Interview Questions: Tell us about how you got into the field?

title: Evergreen Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Overall not particularly rigorous; the process for this interview consisted of a submission of a personal application/statement, an individual interview, and a group process portion. In order to apply for this position, one must have already been a member of the Evergreen orientation staff at Loyola.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a first year student asking about a fake ID

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy-going! I was asked when I had to handle a conflict and how I resolved it. I was asked about former job experiences, my major, and what classes I would like to tutor.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time where you had to handle a conflict with another

title: Student Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Talked with hiring manager at the student tech center. Work flex hours around college schedule, as long as you are comfortable helping students/professors with laptop/phone/application set ups - then you will succeed
Interview Questions: What technical experience do you have

title: Intramural Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland
Interview Descriptions: Short and to the point. The whole thing was done pretty hastily and to be honest, it was my first real job interview, and it was a promotion at that. Asked some not so relevant questions that set up for additional questions later.
Interview Questions: Favorite color

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland
Interview Descriptions: As a work-study student, faculty co-workers treat you with respect and do not overburden students knowing they have a tough course load.  My interview with the department chair was approximately 10 minutes in her office.
Interview Questions: Please describe past work experiences.

title: Innovation Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening interview with search committee, then on site for 5 hours of 1 hour each panels. Most fo the panel interviewers were terrible. They members had never reviewed my materials or resume prior to walking in for a 3/4 day on site interview. They literally were pulling up my resume and materials on their phones for the first time during the interviews. The one exception was the one panel of faculty from across the school - they were well prepared and asked good questions. It took quite a bit not to just walk out of the interview and fly back home immediately. I have no idea why the wasted my time and theirs.  One big thing is it is going on one month later and they still have not reimburse me for my flight and expenses incurred 0 still fighting to get paid for what they promised - very unprofessional for a supposed ethical and christian organization.
Interview Questions: Do you understand the Jesuit catholic mission, and what have you done in your life as service.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
When I went to a job fair, they proposed for an interview.
I applied for an oncology RN  position and later met a floor nurse manager for an interview. The manager asked a few questions and showed their department.
Interview Questions: In 5 years, where will you be in?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Asked question from my previous experience and offered me a position the next day. Asked question about my classes and previous experience as well as my plans for hours. Also explained what the project is and made sure I understood what the work would be like.
Interview Questions: Explain a time you had a dispute within a team/group and what role did you play?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fill out online application, you will be contacted via email, set up interview date and time. Interview took about 30 - 40 minutes. Standard interview questions. Interview was 1:1 then three additional managers came into the interview
Interview Questions: A time you have has to work in a team setting?

title: Graduate Residence Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty simple. You do the application online and then schedule your interview. They ask you a few questions about your experience and how that relates to the position. Having your resume handy is a good idea.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to stand up for someone who had views different from your own?

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for many graduate assistantships on campus. Some were very intense some were more relaxed. Many of them required a phone interview and then an in person interview which was usually in front of a panel of 2-3 people. One of the ones I did was with one person. I got one offer out of 5 or so applications and 3 interviews. This was pretty good considering the assistantships are extremely competitive at Loyola. Plus there are not many to choose from. Most graduate assistance I knew got the jobs in their first year and kept them until they graduated.
Interview Questions: What are your goals after graduations and how can this job help you meet your goals?

title: FAC Building Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the building director and two student employees who were working the position that I was applying for.  The director was somewhat standoffish but it seemed that I had already been accepted simply from a recommendation.
Interview Questions: How are you at dealing with customers?

title: Business Analyst/Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: One time interview scheduled shortly after applying. Interviewed by employees and director of department, about 6 people. They also had a HR person who handles relationships between departments. Only down side is that I have not been able to hear about the position until they took down the posting from their websites.
Interview Questions: Experience in SQL

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland
Interview Descriptions: The interview seemed legitimate, but on its surface only. I feel it has been predetermined based on where you come from. I was one of the finalists and my references have not been contacted even. A lot of BS paperwork required re: mission and such, that actually nobody cares about.
Interview Questions: What kind of research you are planning to conduct?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Columbia, MD) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone screening process. Interviewed by all Department administrative staff and faculty. There were group interviews and individual interviews scheduled in one day.  This was followed by a phone offer.
Interview Questions: Asked about work experience, religious preference, work schedule, and pay.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was quite brief, although I have herd others having to go through multiple rounds. It was primarily personality based assuming thought your resume reflected what it is you said you have done as far as past experiences. At the end of the day my interviewer was primarily concerned with competence.
Interview Questions: Do you have ksao's for Microsoft packages (i.e. excel, access, outlook).

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submit your application, then get an email from tutor coordinator and set up a day and time to interview. Meet at the tutor coordinators office. The interview lasted about 10 minutes and then was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good tutor?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Loyola University Maryland (Baltimore, MD) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: - Universities are all about buy-in from other departments.  You'll meet with your direct supervisor, your direct co-workers and people from other departments that your job will interact with on a regular basis.
Interview Questions:
There is a focus on mission and if you are not familiar with Loyola or it's mission during the interview process you will have a difficult time finding a job here.  There will always be questions around mission such as:
- Why are you applying for a job at Loyola and what about our mission inspires you?
